definitions.definition: People who are young; young people, collectively; youth.
definitions.example: The young of today are well-educated.

definitions.definition: Young or immature offspring (especially of an animal).
definitions.example: The lion caught a gnu to feed its young.

definitions.definition: (possibly nonstandard) An individual offspring; a single recently born or hatched organism.
To become or seem to become younger.
To cause to appear younger.
To exhibit younging.
In the early part of growth or life; born not long ago.
definitions.example: a lamb is a young sheep;  these picture books are for young readers

definitions.definition: At an early stage of existence or development; having recently come into existence.
definitions.example: the age of space travel is still young;   a young business

definitions.definition: (Not) advanced in age; (far towards or) at a specified stage of existence or age.
definitions.example: How young is your dog?   Her grandmother turned 70 years young last month.

definitions.definition: Junior (of two related people with the same name).
(of a decade of life) Early.
Youthful; having the look or qualities of a young person.
definitions.example: My grandmother is a very active woman and is quite young for her age.

definitions.definition: Of or belonging to the early part of life.
definitions.example: The cynical world soon shattered my young dreams.

definitions.definition: Having little experience; inexperienced; unpracticed; ignorant; weak.
A young male.
definitions.example: Kate is dating a boy named Jim.

definitions.definition: (diminutive) A male child: a son of any age.
(diminutive) A male of any age, particularly one rather younger than the speaker.
A male of low station, (especially as pejorative) a worthless male, a wretch; a mean and dishonest male, a knave.
(now rare and usually offensive outside some Commonwealth nations) A male servant, slave, assistant, or employee, particularly:
Any non-white male, regardless of age.
A male animal, especially, in affectionate address, a male dog.
definitions.example: Are you getting a boy cat or a girl cat?

definitions.definition: A former low rank of various armed services; a holder of this rank.
Heroin.
(somewhat childish) A male (tree, gene, etc).
To use the word “boy” to refer to someone.
definitions.example: Don't boy me!

definitions.definition: To act as a boy (in allusion to the former practice of boys acting women's parts on the stage).
Exclamation of surprise, pleasure or longing.
definitions.example: Boy, I wish I could go to Canada!

definitions.definition: To harmonize in opinion, statement, or action; to be in unison or concord; to be or become united or consistent; to concur.
definitions.example: all parties agree in the expediency of the law.

definitions.definition: To yield assent; to accede;—followed by to.
definitions.example: to agree to an offer, or to opinion.

definitions.definition: To yield assent to; to approve.
To make a stipulation by way of settling differences or determining a price; to exchange promises; to come to terms or to a common resolve; to promise.
To be conformable; to resemble; to coincide; to correspond.
definitions.example: the picture does not agree with the original; the two scales agree exactly.

definitions.definition: (now always with with) To suit or be adapted in its effects; to do well.
definitions.example: the same food does not agree with every constitution.

definitions.definition: (grammar) To correspond to (another word) in a grammatical category, such as gender, number, case, or person.
definitions.example: In Romanian, the articles, adjectives, pronouns agree in gender, number and case with the noun they refer to.

definitions.definition: To consent to a contract or to an element of a contract.
The act of catching fish.
definitions.example: We had a good day's fishing at the weekend.

definitions.definition: The act of catching other forms of seafood, separately or together with fish.
Commercial fishing: the business or industry of catching fish and other seafood for sale.
definitions.example: This is good news for the fishing industry.

definitions.definition: A fishery, a place for catching fish.
Of great size, large.
definitions.example: Elephants are big animals, and they eat a lot.

definitions.definition: (of an industry or other field, often capitalized) Thought to have undue influence.
definitions.example: Big Tech

definitions.definition: Popular.
definitions.example: That style is very big right now in Europe, especially among teenagers.

definitions.definition: Adult.
definitions.example: Kids should get help from big people if they want to use the kitchen.

definitions.definition: Fat.
definitions.example: Gosh, she is big!

definitions.definition: Important or significant.
definitions.example: What's so big about that? I do it all the time.

definitions.definition: (with on) Enthusiastic (about).
definitions.example: I'm not big on the idea, but if you want to go ahead with it, I won't stop you.

definitions.definition: Mature, conscientious, principled; generous.
definitions.example: I tried to be the bigger person and just let it go, but I couldn't help myself.

definitions.definition: Well-endowed, possessing large breasts in the case of a woman or a large penis in the case of a man.
definitions.example: Whoa, Nadia has gotten pretty big since she hit puberty.

definitions.definition: (sometimes figurative) Large with young; pregnant; swelling; ready to give birth or produce.
definitions.example: She was big with child.

definitions.definition: Used as an intensifier, especially of negative-valence nouns
definitions.example: You are a big liar.  Why are you in such a big hurry?

definitions.definition: (of a city) populous
(of somebody's age) old, mature. Used to imply that somebody is too old for something, or acting immaturely.
The act of killing.
definitions.example: The assassin liked to make a clean kill, and thus favored small arms over explosives.

definitions.definition: Specifically, the death blow.
definitions.example: The hunter delivered the kill with a pistol shot to the head.

definitions.definition: The result of killing; that which has been killed.
definitions.example: The fox dragged its kill back to its den.

definitions.definition: The grounding of the ball on the opponent's court, winning the rally.
To put to death; to extinguish the life of.
definitions.example: Smoking kills more people each year than alcohol and drugs combined.

definitions.definition: To render inoperative.
definitions.example: He killed the engine and turned off the headlights, but remained in the car, waiting.

definitions.definition: To stop, cease or render void; to terminate.
definitions.example: My computer wouldn't respond until I killed some of the running processes.

definitions.definition: To amaze, exceed, stun or otherwise incapacitate.
definitions.example: That joke always kills me.

definitions.definition: To cause great pain, discomfort or distress to.
definitions.example: These tight shoes are killing my feet.

definitions.definition: To produce feelings of dissatisfaction or revulsion in.
definitions.example: It kills me to learn how many poor people are practically starving in this country while rich moguls spend such outrageous amounts on useless luxuries.

definitions.definition: To use up or to waste.
definitions.example: He told the bartender, pointing at the bottle of scotch he planned to consume, "Leave it, I'm going to kill the bottle."

definitions.definition: To exert an overwhelming effect on.
definitions.example: Between the two of us, we killed the rest of the case of beer.

definitions.definition: To overpower, overwhelm or defeat.
definitions.example: The team had absolutely killed their traditional rivals, and the local sports bars were raucous with celebrations.

definitions.definition: To force a company out of business.
To produce intense pain.
definitions.example: You don't ever want to get rabies. The doctor will have to give you multiple shots and they really kill.

definitions.definition: To punish severely.
definitions.example: My parents are going to kill me!

definitions.definition: To strike (a ball, etc.) with such force and placement as to make a shot that is impossible to defend against, usually winning a point.
To cause (a ball, etc.) to be out of play, resulting in a stoppage of gameplay.
To succeed with an audience, especially in comedy.
To cause to assume the value zero.
(IRC) To disconnect (a user) involuntarily from the network.
To deadmelt.
Someone who is associated with another in a common activity or interest.
One of the pieces of wood comprising the framework which strengthens the deck of a wooden ship around the holes through which the mast and other fittings pass.
A group financial arrangement in which each member contributes a set amount of money over a set period.
To join as a partner.
(often with with) To work or perform as a partner.
A piece of fabric attached to a boat and arranged such that it causes the wind to drive the boat along. The sail may be attached to the boat via a combination of mast, spars and ropes.
(nautical,uncountable) The concept of a sail or sails, as if a substance.
definitions.example: Take in sail: a storm is coming.

definitions.definition: The power harnessed by a sail or sails, or the use of this power for travel or transport.
A trip in a boat, especially a sailboat.
definitions.example: Let's go for a sail.

definitions.definition: (plural "sail") A sailing vessel; a vessel of any kind; a craft.
definitions.example: Twenty sail were in sight.

definitions.definition: The blade of a windmill.
A tower-like structure found on the dorsal (topside) surface of submarines.
The floating organ of siphonophores, such as the Portuguese man-of-war.
A sailfish.
definitions.example: We caught three sails today.

definitions.definition: An outward projection of the spine, occurring in certain dinosaurs and synapsids
Anything resembling a sail, such as a wing.
The act of returning.
definitions.example: I expect the house to be spotless upon my return.

definitions.definition: A return ticket.
definitions.example: Do you want a one-way or a return?

definitions.definition: An item that is returned, e.g. due to a defect, or the act of returning it.
definitions.example: Last year there were 250 returns of this product, an improvement on the 500 returns the year before.

definitions.definition: An answer.
definitions.example: a return to one's question

definitions.definition: An account, or formal report, of an action performed, of a duty discharged, of facts or statistics, etc.; especially, in the plural, a set of tabulated statistics prepared for general information.
definitions.example: election returns; a return of the amount of goods produced or sold

definitions.definition: Gain or loss from an investment.
definitions.example: It yielded a return of 5%.

definitions.definition: : A report of income submitted to a government for purposes of specifying exact tax payment amounts. A tax return.
definitions.example: Hand in your return by the end of the tax year.

definitions.definition: A carriage return character.
The act of relinquishing control to the calling procedure.
A return value: the data passed back from a called procedure.
A return pipe, returning fluid to a boiler or other central plant (compare with flow pipe, which carries liquid away from central plant).
definitions.example: The boiler technician had to cut out the heating return to access the safety valve.

definitions.definition: A short perpendicular extension of a desk, usually slightly lower.
Catching a ball after a punt and running it back towards the opposing team.
A throw from a fielder to the wicket-keeper or to another fielder at the wicket.

The continuation in a different direction, most often at a right angle, of a building, face of a building, or any member, such as a moulding; applied to the shorter in contradistinction to the longer.
definitions.example: A facade of sixty feet east and west has a return of twenty feet north and south.

definitions.definition: To come or go back (to a place or person).
definitions.example: Although the birds fly north for the summer, they return here in winter.

definitions.definition: To go back in thought, narration, or argument.
definitions.example: To return to my story [...]

definitions.definition: To turn back, retreat.
To turn (something) round.
To place or put back something where it had been.
definitions.example: Please return your hands to your lap.

definitions.definition: To give something back to its original holder or owner.
definitions.example: You should return the library book within one month.

definitions.definition: To take back something to a vendor for a refund.
definitions.example: If the goods don't work, you can return them.

definitions.definition: To give in requital or recompense; to requite.
To bat the ball back over the net in response to a serve.
definitions.example: The player couldn't return the serve because it was so fast.

definitions.definition: To play a card as a result of another player's lead.
definitions.example: If one players plays a trump, the others must return a trump.

definitions.definition: To throw a ball back to the wicket-keeper (or a fielder at that position) from somewhere in the field.
To say in reply; to respond.
definitions.example: to return an answer;  to return thanks;  "Do it yourself!" she returned.

definitions.definition: To relinquish control to the calling procedure.
To pass (data) back to the calling procedure.
definitions.example: This function returns the number of files in the directory.

definitions.definition: To retort; to throw back.
definitions.example: to return the lie

definitions.definition: To report, or bring back and make known.
definitions.example: to return the result of an election

definitions.definition: (by extension) To elect according to the official report of the election officers.
Merchandise returned to the retailer, wholesaler or supplier.
A mild, light-coloured kind of tobacco.
The rendering back of a writ to the proper officer.
The return of the soldiers fit for duty.
The act of killing.

definitions.definition: Specifically, the death blow.

definitions.definition: To force a company out of business.
To produce intense pain.
definitions.example: You don't ever want to get rabies. The doctor will have to give you multiple shots and they really kill.

definitions.definition: To punish severely.
definitions.example: My parents are going to kill me!

definitions.definition: To strike (a ball, etc.) with such force and placement as to make a shot that is impossible to defend against, usually winning a point.
To cause (a ball, etc.) to be out of play, resulting in a stoppage of gameplay.
To succeed with an audience, especially in comedy.
To cause to assume the value zero.
(IRC) To disconnect (a user) involuntarily from the network.
To deadmelt.
(north-east US) A creek; a body of water; a channel or arm of the sea.

definitions.definition: A kiln.
To apply violent force to someone or something.
definitions.example: This species of snake will only attack humans if it feels threatened.

definitions.definition: To aggressively challenge a person, idea, etc., with words (particularly in newspaper headlines, because it typesets into less space than "criticize" or similar).
definitions.example: She published an article attacking the recent pay cuts.

definitions.definition: To begin to affect; to act upon injuriously or destructively; to begin to decompose or waste.
To deal with something in a direct way; to set to work upon.
definitions.example: I attacked the meal with a hearty appetite.

definitions.definition: To aim balls at the batsman’s wicket.
To set a field, or bowl in a manner designed to get wickets.
To bat aggressively, so as to score runs quickly.
To move forward in an active attempt to score a point, as opposed to trying not to concede.
To accelerate quickly in an attempt to get ahead of the other riders.
A cold-blooded vertebrate animal that lives in water, moving with the help of fins and breathing with gills.
definitions.example: Salmon is a fish.

definitions.definition: Any animal (or any vertebrate) that lives exclusively in water.
The flesh of the fish used as food.
definitions.example: The seafood pasta had lots of fish but not enough pasta.

definitions.definition: A card game in which the object is to obtain cards in pairs or sets of four (depending on the variation), by asking the other players for cards of a particular rank.
A woman.
An easy victim for swindling.
A bad poker player. Compare shark (a good poker player).
A makeshift overlapping longitudinal brace, originally shaped roughly like a fish, used to temporarily repair or extend a spar or mast of a ship.
A purchase used to fish the anchor.
A torpedo.
A paraphyletic grouping of the following extant taxonomic groups:
The thirty-fourth Lenormand card.
Used as plural of person; a body of human beings considered generally or collectively; a group of two or more persons.
definitions.example: There were so many people at the restaurant last night.

definitions.definition: Persons forming or belonging to a particular group, such as a nation, class, ethnic group, country, family, etc.
A group of persons regarded as being employees, followers, companions or subjects of a ruler.
One's colleagues or employees.
A person's ancestors, relatives or family.
definitions.example: My people lived through the Black Plague and the Thirty Years War.

definitions.definition: The mass of a community as distinguished from a special class (elite); the commonalty; the populace; the vulgar; the common crowd; the citizens.
To stock with people or inhabitants; to fill as with people; to populate.
To become populous or populated.
To inhabit; to occupy; to populate.
To interact with people; to socialize.
An individual; usually a human being.
definitions.example: Each person is unique, both mentally and physically.

definitions.definition: The physical body of a being seen as distinct from the mind, character, etc.
Any individual or formal organization with standing before the courts.
definitions.example: At common law a corporation or a trust is legally a person.

definitions.definition: The human genitalia; specifically, the penis.
(grammar) A linguistic category used to distinguish between the speaker of an utterance and those to whom or about whom he or she is speaking. See grammatical person.
A shoot or bud of a plant; a polyp or zooid of the compound Hydrozoa, Anthozoa, etc.; also, an individual, in the narrowest sense, among the higher animals.
(plural) The people of England; Englishmen and Englishwomen.
definitions.example: The Scottish and the English have a history of conflict.

definitions.definition: (Amish, plural) The non-Amish; non-Amish people.
Ability to employ the English language correctly or idiomatically.
definitions.example: My coworkers have pretty good English for non-native speakers.

definitions.definition: The English-language term or expression for something.

definitions.definition: Specific language or wording in English; English text or statements in speech, whether in translation or otherwise.
definitions.example: The technical details are correct, but much of the English is not very clear.

definitions.definition: A size of type between pica (12 point) and great primer (18 point), standardized as 14-point.
Plain or readily understandable English language.
Spin or sidespin given to a ball, especially in pool or billiards.

definitions.definition: A near relative.
Having the same mother and father; a full (brother or sister).

definitions.definition: Being born to one’s blood aunt or uncle, a first (cousin).
definitions.example: cousin-german

definitions.definition: Closely related, akin.

definitions.definition: Mako shark
An act of pulling (applying force)

definitions.definition: An attractive force which causes motion towards the source
definitions.example: She took a pull on her cigarette.

definitions.definition: Any device meant to be pulled, as a lever, knob, handle, or rope
definitions.example: a zipper pull

definitions.definition: Something in one's favour in a comparison or a contest; an advantage; means of influencing.
definitions.example: In weights the favourite had the pull.

definitions.definition: Appeal or attraction (e.g. of a movie star)
The situation where a client sends out a request for data from a server, as in server pull, pull technology
A journey made by rowing
A contest; a struggle.

definitions.definition: Loss or violence suffered.
The act of drinking; a mouthful or swig of a drink.

definitions.definition: A kind of stroke by which a leg ball is sent to the off side, or an off ball to the side.
A mishit shot which travels in a straight line and (for a right-handed player) left of the intended path.
A single impression from a handpress.
To apply a force to (an object) so that it comes toward the person or thing applying the force.
definitions.example: When I give the signal, pull the rope.

definitions.definition: To gather with the hand, or by drawing toward oneself; to pluck.
definitions.example: pull a finch

definitions.definition: To attract or net; to pull in.
To persuade (someone) to have sex with one.
definitions.example: He's pulled that bird over there.

definitions.definition: To remove (something), especially from public circulation or availability.
definitions.example: Each day, they pulled the old bread and set out fresh loaves.

definitions.definition: To retrieve or generate for use.
definitions.example: I'll have to pull a part number for that.

definitions.definition: To do or perform.
definitions.example: He regularly pulls 12-hour days, sometimes 14.

definitions.definition: (with 'a' and the name of a person, place, event, etc.) To copy or emulate the actions or behaviour that is associated with the person or thing mentioned.
definitions.example: He pulled an Elvis and got really fat.

definitions.definition: To toss a frisbee with the intention of launching the disc across the length of a field.
To row.
To achieve by rowing on a rowing machine.
definitions.example: I pulled a personal best on the erg yesterday.

definitions.definition: To draw apart; to tear; to rend.
To strain (a muscle, tendon, ligament, etc.).
To draw (a hostile non-player character) into combat, or toward or away from some location or target.
To score a certain number of points in a sport.

definitions.definition: To hold back, and so prevent from winning.

definitions.definition: To take or make (a proof or impression); so called because hand presses were worked by pulling a lever.
To strike the ball in a particular manner. (See noun sense.)
To draw beer from a pump, keg, or other source.

definitions.definition: (rail transportation, of a railroad car) To pull out from a yard or station; to leave.
To pluck or pick (flowers, fruit etc.).
With a comparative or with more and a verb phrase, establishes a correlation with one or more other such comparatives.

definitions.definition: With a comparative, and often with for it, indicates a result more like said comparative. This can be negated with none. See none the.
definitions.example: I'm much the wiser for having had a difficult time like that.

definitions.definition: The system that provides support to an organism, internal and made up of bones and cartilage in vertebrates, external in some other animals.
An anthropomorphic representation of a skeleton.

definitions.definition: A very thin person.

definitions.definition: The central core of something that gives shape to the entire structure.

To minimize

definitions.definition: (chiefly in phenomenology) A particular instant in time, as perceived at that instant.
Present; current.
Fashionable; popular; up to date; current.

definitions.definition: At the time the will is written. Used in order to prevent any inheritance from being transferred to a person of a future marriage. Does not indicate the existence of a previous marriage.

definitions.definition: At the present time.

definitions.definition: (sentence) Used to introduce a point, a qualification of what has previously been said, a remonstration or a rebuke.

definitions.definition: Differently from the immediate past; differently from a more remote past or a possible future; differently from all other times.

definitions.definition: Differently from the situation before a stated event or change of circumstance.

definitions.definition: At the time reached within a narration.

definitions.definition: In the context of urgency.

definitions.definition: As 'but now': Very recently; not long ago; up to the present.
Since, because, in light of the fact; often with that.

definitions.definition: To start, to initiate or take the first step into something.

definitions.definition: To be in the first stage of some situation

definitions.definition: To come into existence.
To do.

A vessel (boat or ship) used for fishing.
An option allowing a gamer to resume play after game over, when all lives have been lost.
A statement which causes a loop to start executing the next iteration, skipping the statements following it.
To proceed with (doing an activity); to prolong (an activity).

definitions.definition: To make last; to prolong.
To retain (someone or something) in a given state, position, etc.
To remain in a given place or condition; to remain in connection with; to abide; to stay.
To resume.

definitions.definition: To adjourn, prorogue, put off.

definitions.definition: To make a continuation bet.
To ingest; to be ingested.
To use up.
To cause (someone) to worry.

definitions.definition: To take the loss in a transaction.
To be injured or killed by (something such as a firearm or its projectile), especially in the mouth.

definitions.definition: To perform oral sex (on a person or body part).

definitions.definition: To arouse interest.

definitions.definition: To draw by moral, emotional or sexual influence; to engage or fix, as the mind, attention, etc.; to invite or allure.

definitions.definition: A rural habitation of size between a hamlet and a town.

definitions.definition: A rural habitation that has a church, but no market.
A planned community such as a retirement community or shopping district.
A gated community.
To a greater degree or extent.

definitions.definition: Used to form the comparative form of adjectives and adverbs.

definitions.definition: In negative constructions: any further, any longer; any more.
Used in addition to an inflected comparative form.

definitions.definition: A greater number or quantity (of something).

definitions.definition: An extra or additional quantity (of something).

definitions.definition: A wealthy or privileged person.
One who has some (contextually specified) thing.

definitions.definition: To hold, as something at someone's disposal.

definitions.definition: Used to state the existence or presence of someone in a specified relationship with the subject.

definitions.definition: Connects at least two alternative words, phrases, clauses, sentences, etc. each of which could make a passage true. In English, this is the "inclusive or." The "exclusive or" is formed by "either [...] or".

definitions.definition: An operator denoting the disjunction of two propositions or truth values. There are two forms, the inclusive or and the exclusive or.
Counts the elements before and after as two possibilities.
Otherwise (a consequence of the condition that the previous is false).
definitions.example: It's raining! Come inside or you'll catch a cold!

definitions.definition: Connects two equivalent names.
definitions.example: The country Myanmar, or Burma

definitions.definition: Influence or authority over something.

definitions.definition: (relative) Used of people (now generally who, whom or that).
An end or conclusion.
definitions.example: We owe them our thanks for bringing the project to a successful close.

definitions.definition: The manner of shutting; the union of parts; junction.
A grapple in wrestling.
The conclusion of a strain of music; cadence.
A double bar marking the end.
(travel) The time when checkin staff will no longer accept passengers for a flight.
(physical) To remove a gap.
(social) To finish, to terminate.
To come or gather around; to enclose; to encompass; to confine.
To have a vector sum of 0; that is, to form a closed polygon.
Sufficiently.
definitions.example: Are you man enough to fight me?

definitions.definition: Fully; quite; used to express slight augmentation of the positive degree, and sometimes equivalent to very.
definitions.example: He is ready enough to accept the offer.

definitions.definition: A sufficient or adequate number, amount, etc.
definitions.example: Enough of you are here to begin the class.

definitions.definition: Stop! Don't do that any more!
definitions.example: I'm sick of you complaining! Enough!

definitions.definition: To last, continue, endure.
For all of a given time interval.
definitions.example: I lived with my parents during the 1970s.

definitions.definition: At any time or period within a given time interval.
definitions.example: I lived with my parents at several points during the 1980s.

definitions.definition: An attempt to cause damage, injury to, or death of opponent or enemy.
An attempt to detract from the worth or credibility of, a person, position, idea, object, or thing, by physical, verbal, emotional, or other assault.
definitions.example: They claimed the censorship of the article was an attack on free speech.

definitions.definition: A time in which one attacks; the offence of a battle.
definitions.example: The army timed their attack to coincide with the local celebrations.

definitions.definition: (by extension) The beginning of active operations on anything.
definitions.example: Having washed the plates from dinner, I made an attack on the laundry.

definitions.definition: An attempt to exploit a vulnerability in a computer system.
Collectively, the bowlers of a cricket side.
Any contact with the ball other than a serve or block which sends the ball across the plane of the net.
The three attackmen on the field or all the attackmen of a team.
The sudden onset of a disease or condition.
definitions.example: I've had an attack of the flu.

definitions.definition: An active episode of a chronic or recurrent disease.
The onset of a musical note, particularly with respect to the strength (and duration) of that onset.

(audio) The amount of time it takes for the volume of an audio signal to go from zero to maximum level (e.g. an audio waveform representing a snare drum hit would feature a very fast attack, whereas that of a wave washing to shore would feature a slow attack).
To apply violent force to someone or something.
definitions.example: This species of snake will only attack humans if it feels threatened.

definitions.definition: To aggressively challenge a person, idea, etc., with words (particularly in newspaper headlines, because it typesets into less space than "criticize" or similar).
definitions.example: She published an article attacking the recent pay cuts.

definitions.definition: To begin to affect; to act upon injuriously or destructively; to begin to decompose or waste.
To deal with something in a direct way; to set to work upon.
definitions.example: I attacked the meal with a hearty appetite.

definitions.definition: To aim balls at the batsman’s wicket.
To set a field, or bowl in a manner designed to get wickets.
To bat aggressively, so as to score runs quickly.
To move forward in an active attempt to score a point, as opposed to trying not to concede.
To accelerate quickly in an attempt to get ahead of the other riders.
Brand or kind; model.
definitions.example: What make of car do you drive?

definitions.definition: Manner or style of construction (style of how a thing is made); form.
Origin (of a manufactured article); manufacture; production.
definitions.example: The camera was of German make.

definitions.definition: A person's character or disposition.
The act or process of making something, especially in industrial manufacturing.
Quantity produced, especially of materials.
A software utility for automatically building large applications, or an implementation of this utility.
Identification or recognition (of identity), especially from police records or evidence.
(usually in phrase "easy make") Past, present or future target of seduction (usually female).
A promotion.
A home-made project
Turn to declare the trump for a hand (in bridge), or to shuffle the cards.
A made basket.
The closing of an electrical circuit.
To create.
To behave, to act.
definitions.example: He made as if to punch him, but they both laughed and shook hands.

definitions.definition: To tend; to contribute; to have effect; with for or against.
To constitute.
definitions.example: One swallow does not a summer make.

definitions.definition: To add up to, have a sum of.
definitions.example: Two and four make six.

definitions.definition: (construed with of, typically interrogative) To interpret.
definitions.example: I don’t know what to make of it.

definitions.definition: (usually stressed) To bring into success.
definitions.example: She married into wealth and so has it made.

definitions.definition: (ditransitive, second object is an adjective or participle) To cause to be.
definitions.example: Did I make myself heard?

definitions.definition: To cause to appear to be; to represent as.
(ditransitive, second object is a verb) To cause (to do something); to compel (to do something).
definitions.example: I was made to feel like a criminal.

definitions.definition: (ditransitive, second object is a verb, can be stressed for emphasis or clarity) To force to do.
definitions.example: Don’t let them make you suffer.

definitions.definition: (ditransitive, of a fact) To indicate or suggest to be.
definitions.example: His past mistakes don’t make him a bad person.

definitions.definition: (of a bed) To cover neatly with bedclothes.
(law enforcement) To recognise, identify, spot.
To arrive at a destination, usually at or by a certain time.
definitions.example: We should make Cincinnati by 7 tonight.

definitions.definition: To proceed (in a direction).
definitions.example: Make for the hills! It's a wildfire!

definitions.definition: To cover (a given distance) by travelling.
To move at (a speed).
definitions.example: The ship could make 20 knots an hour in calm seas.

definitions.definition: To appoint; to name.
To induct into the Mafia or a similar organization (as a made man).
To defecate or urinate.
To earn, to gain (money, points, membership or status).
definitions.example: He didn't make the choir after his voice changed.

definitions.definition: To pay, to cover (an expense); chiefly used after expressions of inability.
To compose verses; to write poetry; to versify.
To enact; to establish.
To develop into; to prove to be.
definitions.example: She'll make a fine president.

definitions.definition: To form or formulate in the mind.
definitions.example: made a questionable decision

definitions.definition: To perform a feat.
definitions.example: make a leap

definitions.definition: To gain sufficient audience to warrant its existence.
definitions.example: In the end, my class didn't make, which left me with a bit of free time.

definitions.definition: To act in a certain manner; to have to do; to manage; to interfere; to be active; often in the phrase to meddle or make.
To increase; to augment; to accrue.
To be engaged or concerned in.
To cause to be (in a specified place), used after a subjective what.
To take the virginity of.
To have sexual intercourse with.
A meeting, especially one that is unplanned or unexpected.
definitions.example: Their encounter was a matter of chance.

definitions.definition: A hostile, often violent meeting; a confrontation, skirmish, or clash, as between combatants.
A match between two opposing sides.
To meet (someone) or find (something), especially unexpectedly.
To confront (someone or something) face to face.
To engage in conflict, as with an enemy.
definitions.example: Three armies encountered at Waterloo.

definitions.definition: A discrete division of something.
A sharp extremity.
One of the several different parts of the escutcheon.
A short piece of cordage used in reefing sails.
A string or lace used to tie together certain garments.
Lace worked by the needle.
definitions.example: point de Venise; Brussels point

definitions.definition: An item of private information; a hint; a tip; a pointer.
The attitude assumed by a pointer dog when he finds game.
definitions.example: The dog came to a point.

definitions.definition: The perpendicular rising of a hawk over the place where its prey has gone into cover.
The act of pointing, as of the foot downward in certain dance positions.
The gesture of extending the index finger in a direction in order to indicate something.
A vaccine point.
In various sports, a position of a certain player, or, by extension, the player occupying that position.
A soldier fit for duty
Having the power to produce a required effect or effects.
definitions.example: The pill is an effective method of birth control.

definitions.definition: Producing a decided or decisive effect.
definitions.example: The president delivered an effective speech!

definitions.definition: Efficient, serviceable, or operative, available for useful work.
definitions.example: How long does it take to make a bunch of civilians an effective military force?

definitions.definition: Actually in effect.
definitions.example: The curfew is effective at midnight.

definitions.definition: (of a cycle or divisor) Having no negative coefficients.
(for any effective theory) approximate; Not describing the fundamental dynamic changes in some system as they happen.

definitions.definition: The sharp cutting edge of a knife, chisel, or other tool, a razor blade/sword.
The flat functional end of a propeller, oar, hockey stick, screwdriver, skate, etc.
The narrow leaf of a grass or cereal.
The thin, flat part of a plant leaf, attached to a stem (petiole). The lamina.
A flat bone, especially the shoulder blade.
A cut of beef from near the shoulder blade (part of the chuck).
The part of the tongue just behind the tip, used to make laminal consonants.
A sword or knife.
A piece of prepared, sharp-edged stone, often flint, at least twice as long as it is wide; a long flake of ground-edge stone or knapped vitreous stone.
(ultimate frisbee) A throw characterized by a tight parabolic trajectory due to a steep lateral attitude.

A dashing young man.
A homosexual, usually male.
Thin plate, foil.
One of a series of small plates that make up the aperture or the shutter of a camera.
(in the plural) The principal rafters of a roof.
The four large shell plates on the sides, and the five large ones of the middle, of the carapace of the sea turtle, which yield the best tortoise shell.
Airfoil in windmills and windturbines.
A blade server.
An exterior product of vectors. (The product may have more than two factors. Also, a scalar counts as a 0-blade, a vector as a 1-blade; an exterior product of k vectors may be called a k-blade.)
The part of a key that is inserted into the lock.
To skate on rollerblades.
definitions.example: Want to go blading with me later in the park?

definitions.definition: To furnish with a blade.
To put forth or have a blade.
To stab with a blade
definitions.example: The gang member got bladed in a fight.

definitions.definition: To cut (a person) so as to provoke bleeding.
A kind of piton used in thin cracks.

One of four seasons, traditionally the second, marked by the longest and typically hottest days of the year due to the inclination of the Earth and thermal lag. Typically regarded as being from June 21 to September 22 or 23 in parts of the USA, the months of June, July and August in the United Kingdom and the months of December, January and February in the Southern Hemisphere.
definitions.example: the heat of summer

definitions.definition: Year; used to give the age of a person, usually a young one.
definitions.example: He was barely eighteen summers old.

definitions.definition: Someone with light, pinkish skin that has a blue undertone, light hair and eyes, seen as best suited to certain colors of clothing.
To spend the summer, as in a particular place on holiday.
definitions.example: We like to summer in the Mediterranean.

definitions.definition: A human being, whether man, woman or child.
definitions.example: Humans share common ancestors with other apes.

definitions.definition: To behave as or become, or to cause to behave as or become, a human.
(notcomp) Of or belonging to the species Homo sapiens or its closest relatives.
Having the nature or attributes of a human being.
definitions.example: To err is human; to forgive, divine.

Such a piece that has been divided.

definitions.definition: A part of a larger whole, usually in such a form that it is able to be separated from other parts.

definitions.definition: A single item belonging to a class of similar items
definitions.example: a piece of machinery

definitions.definition: One of the figures used in playing chess, specifically a higher-value figure as distinguished from a pawn; by extension, a similar counter etc. in other games.

definitions.definition: An artistic creation, such as a painting, sculpture, musical composition, literary work, etc.

definitions.definition: An article published in the press.

definitions.definition: An artillery gun.
A gun.

definitions.definition: (short for hairpiece) A toupee or wig, especially when worn by a man.

definitions.definition: A slice or other quantity of bread, eaten on its own; a sandwich or light snack.
A sexual encounter; from piece of ass or piece of tail

definitions.definition: A cannabis pipe.

definitions.definition: (sometimes derogatory) An individual; a person.
A castle; a fortified building.
A pacifier; a dummy.
A distance.

definitions.definition: A structured practice row, often used for performance evaluation.

definitions.definition: An amount of work to be done at one time; a unit of piece work.
(usually with together) To assemble (something real or figurative).
definitions.example: These clues allowed us to piece together the solution to the mystery.

definitions.definition: To make, enlarge, or repair, by the addition of a piece or pieces; to patch; often with out.

definitions.definition: To produce a work of graffiti more complex than a tag.
In a typical or common manner.
In an expected or customary manner.
Literary type using invented or imaginative writing, instead of real facts, usually written as prose.
definitions.example: I am a great reader of fiction.

definitions.definition: A verbal or written account that is not based on actual events (often intended to mislead).

definitions.definition: A legal fiction.
Someone who lives in modern times.
Pertaining to a current or recent time and style; not ancient.

To change with a specific direction, progress.

definitions.definition: To advance; to further; to promote the growth of.
To create.

definitions.definition: To bring out images latent in photographic film.
definitions.example: Please develop this roll of film.

definitions.definition: To acquire something usually over a period of time.
definitions.example: I have been in England enough to develop a British accent.

definitions.definition: To place one's pieces actively.
definitions.example: I need to develop my white-square bishop.

definitions.definition: To cause a ball to become more open and available to be played on later. Usually by moving it away from the cushion, or by opening a pack.
To change the form of (an algebraic expression, etc.) by executing certain indicated operations without changing the value.
(said of a country) Not primitive; not third-world.
Mature.
Containing man-made structures such as roads, sewers, electric lines, buildings, and so on.
Having useful or necessary infrastructure.
Advanced, fully formed.
Having a broad range (of different elements).

definitions.definition: That varies or differs from others; variant; different.
definitions.example: a various reading of a Biblical text

definitions.definition: A group sharing a common understanding, and often the same language, law, manners, and/or tradition.
A residential or religious collective; a commune.
A group of interdependent organisms inhabiting the same region and interacting with each other.
A group of people interacting by electronic means for educational, professional, social, or other purposes; a virtual community.
The condition of having certain attitudes and interests in common.
Common enjoyment or possession; participation.
definitions.example: a community of goods

definitions.definition: Common character; likeness.
Commonness; frequency.
Control or occupancy of something for which one does not necessarily have private property rights.
Something that is owned.
definitions.example: I would gladly give all of my worldly possessions just to be able to do that.

definitions.definition: Ownership; taking, holding, keeping something as one's own.
definitions.example: I'm in possession of the car.

definitions.definition: A territory under the rule of another country.
definitions.example: Réunion is the largest of France's overseas possessions.

definitions.definition: The condition or affliction of being possessed by a demon or other supernatural entity.
definitions.example: Back then, people with psychiatric disorders were sometimes thought to be victims of demonic possession.

definitions.definition: The condition of being under the control of strong emotion or madness.
Control of the ball; the opportunity to be on the offensive.

definitions.definition: A disposal of the ball during a game, i.e. a kick or a handball.
A syntactic relationship between two nouns or nominals that may be used to indicate ownership.

definitions.definition: To invest with property.
To arrive, come (to a place).
To come about; happen; come into being; arise.

definitions.definition: Begin to be; turn into.
definitions.example: She became a doctor when she was 25.

definitions.definition: To be proper for; to beseem.

definitions.definition: (manner) In accordance with the facts; truthfully, accurately.
(modal) Honestly, genuinely, in fact, really.

definitions.definition: (degree) Very.

definitions.definition: To hold dear.

An instant of time.

definitions.definition: (grammar) Tense.

definitions.definition: To choose when something begins or how long it lasts.

definitions.definition: To keep or beat time; to proceed or move in time.
To pass time; to delay.
To regulate as to time; to accompany, or agree with, in time of movement.
To measure, as in music or harmony.
Reminder by the umpire for the players to continue playing after their pause.
The umpire's call in prizefights, etc.
A call by a bartender to warn patrons that the establishment is closing and no more drinks will be served.
The one that follows after this one.

definitions.definition: Nearest in place or position, having nothing similar intervening; adjoining.
Nearest in order, succession, or rank; immediately following (or sometimes preceding) in order.

definitions.definition: Following in a hypothetical sequence of some kind.

definitions.definition: Nearest in relationship. (See also next of kin.)
In a time, place, rank or sequence closest or following.

definitions.definition: On the first subsequent occasion.

definitions.definition: On the side of; nearest or adjacent to; next to.

Having traits or characteristics in common; alike, comparable.

A financial instrument that shows that one owns a part of a company that provides the benefit of limited liability.
A configuration enabling a resource to be shared over a network.

definitions.definition: The action of sharing something with other people via social media.
The sharebone or pubis.
To give part of what one has to somebody else to use or consume.
To have or use in common.

definitions.definition: To divide and distribute.
To tell to another.

definitions.definition: A number of things that follow on one after the other or are connected one after the other.

definitions.definition: A television or radio program which consists of several episodes that are broadcast in regular intervals

definitions.definition: The sequence of partial sums \sum_{i=1}^n{a_i} of a given sequence ai.

definitions.definition: A group of matches between two sides, with the aim being to win more matches than the opposition.

definitions.definition: An unranked taxon.

A parcel of rough diamonds of assorted qualities.
A set of consonants that share a particular phonetic or phonological feature.
Connected one after the other in a circuit.

definitions.definition: A tool for finding whether a surface is level, or for creating a horizontal or vertical line of reference.

definitions.definition: Degree or amount.

definitions.definition: Achievement or qualification.

definitions.definition: A floor of a multi-storey building.

definitions.definition: An area of almost perfectly flat land.
A school grade or year.

definitions.definition: To destroy by reducing to ground level; to raze.

definitions.definition: To progress to the next level.
definitions.example: I levelled after defeating the dragon.

definitions.definition: To aim or direct (a weapon, a stare, an accusation, etc).

definitions.definition: To direct or impose (a penalty, fine, etc) at or upon (someone).
To make the score of a game equal.
To bring to a common level or plane, in respect of rank, condition, character, privilege, etc.

definitions.definition: To adjust or adapt to a certain level.

definitions.definition: (usually with "with") To speak honestly and openly with.
A phase.

definitions.definition: A platform; a surface, generally elevated, upon which show performances or other public events are given.
definitions.example: The band returned to the stage to play an encore.

definitions.definition: A floor or storey of a house.
A floor elevated for the convenience of mechanical work, etc.; scaffolding; staging.
A platform, often floating, serving as a kind of wharf.
A stagecoach, an enclosed horsedrawn carriage used to carry passengers.
definitions.example: The stage pulled into town carrying the payroll for the mill and three ladies.

definitions.definition: A place of rest on a regularly travelled road; a station; a place appointed for a relay of horses.
A degree of advancement in a journey; one of several portions into which a road or course is marked off; the distance between two places of rest on a road.

definitions.definition: The number of an electronic circuit’s block, such as a filter, an amplifier, etc.

definitions.definition: The place on a microscope where the slide is located for viewing.

definitions.definition: A level; one of the sequential areas making up the game.

definitions.definition: A place where anything is publicly exhibited, or a remarkable affair occurs; the scene.
The succession of rock strata laid down in a single age on the geologic time scale.
To produce on a stage, to perform a play.

definitions.definition: To demonstrate in a deceptive manner.

definitions.definition: To orchestrate; to carry out.

definitions.definition: To place in position to prepare for use.

definitions.definition: To determine what stage (a disease, etc.) has progressed to
The third planet of the Solar System; the world upon which humans live.
The personification of the Earth or earth, as a fertile woman or goddess.
Soil.

definitions.definition: Any general rock-based material.

definitions.definition: The ground, land (as opposed to the sky or sea).

definitions.definition: A connection electrically to the earth ((US) ground); on equipment: a terminal connected in that manner.
The lair (as a hole on the ground) of an animal such as fox.
A region of the planet; a land or country.
Worldly things, as against spiritual ones.
The world of our current life (as opposed to heaven or an afterlife).
The people on the globe.
The human body.
The aforementioned soil- or rock-based material, considered one of the four or five classical elements.
Any of certain substances now known to be oxides of metal, which were distinguished by being infusible, and by insolubility in water.
To connect electrically to the earth.
definitions.example: That noise is because the amplifier is not properly earthed.

definitions.definition: To bury.
To burrow.
Of high or especially quick cognitive capacity, bright.
Well thought-out, well considered.

definitions.definition: Characterized by thoughtful interaction.

definitions.definition: Having the same level of brain power as mankind.

definitions.definition: Something being indicated that is similar to something else.
A person, a thing, people or things like the one or ones already mentioned.
Each of the seven major bodies which move relative to the fixed stars in the night sky—the Moon, Mercury, Venus, the Sun, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn.

A body which orbits the Sun directly and is massive enough to be in hydrostatic equilibrium (effectively meaning a spheroid) and to dominate its orbit; specifically, the eight major bodies of Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. (Pluto was considered a planet until 2006 and has now been reclassified as a dwarf planet.)
A large body which directly orbits any star (or star cluster) but which has not attained nuclear fusion.
In phrases such as the planet, this planet, sometimes refers to the Earth.
To hold inside.
To include as a part.
To put constraint upon; to restrain; to confine; to keep within bounds.

definitions.definition: (of a set etc.) To have as an element or subset.

definitions.definition: To restrain desire; to live in continence or chastity.
(in the plural) contents
A whole number that can be divided by another number with no remainder.

definitions.definition: Price-earnings ratio.
One of a set of the same thing; a duplicate.
A single individual who has multiple personalities.
One of a set of siblings produced by a multiple birth.
A chain store.
A discovery resulting from the work of many people throughout history, not merely the work of the person who makes the final connection.
More than one (followed by plural).

definitions.definition: Having more than one element, part, component, or function, having more than one instance, occurring more than once, usually contrary to expectations (can be followed by a singular).

definitions.definition: A long-standing group of people sharing cultural aspects such as language, dress, norms of behavior and artistic forms.

definitions.definition: A group of people who meet from time to time to engage in a common interest; an association or organization.

definitions.definition: A female parent of an animal.

definitions.definition: A female ancestor.

definitions.definition: Something that is the greatest or most significant of its kind. (See mother of all.)

definitions.definition: Any elderly woman, especially within a particular community.

The principal piece of an astrolabe, into which the others are fixed.

Hysterical passion; hysteria; the uterus.

definitions.definition: To surround.

definitions.definition: So as to surround or be near.
